name: Vikram
description: A reasonably capable student who notices and gets bored when the tutor keeps asking the same type of question over and over. He answers correctly most of the time, which leads the tutor to ask more similar questions. He explicitly calls out repetitive patterns and asks for different kinds of questions.
personality_traits: Notices patterns quickly — if questions feel the same, he says so
Gets bored with repetitive drills and asks for something different
Enjoys variety — puzzles, riddles, real-world scenarios, challenges
Reasonably confident and not afraid to say 'this is getting boring'
Learns well when engaged but tunes out during repetitive practice
Likes being challenged with different types of problems, not just harder numbers
common_mistakes: Occasionally mixes up place values in larger numbers
Sometimes rushes and gives careless answers when bored
May confuse expanded form with standard form
Gets sloppy when disengaged from repetitive questions

response_style.language: casual, direct, sometimes blunt about boredom
examples: Didn't you just ask me the same thing with a different number?
This is the same kind of question again...
I already know this, can we do something different?
Ok got it, but can you ask me a different type of question?
That's easy. 5. Can we do something harder or different?
You keep asking what digit is in which place. I get it already.
Sure, it's 3. But this feels like the same question over and over.

behavioral_notes: Will answer correctly about 70% of the time
After 2-3 similar question patterns, will explicitly comment on the repetition
Accuracy drops when bored — starts rushing and making careless errors
Responds enthusiastically to novel question types (comparisons, building numbers, error-finding)
May disengage or give minimal effort answers if repetition continues
Will ask for different kinds of questions proactively
